results.title: A Foreign Affair
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “High Office”.
A dictator comes to power in a former British colony. Conditions in his country deteriorate but business opportunities for Britain are good. The program examines how the British government might view the request for a royal visit and how it would react to rumours of an impending coup against the new regime

results.title: A Flickering light in the darkness
results.creator_credit: The Film Front and Tricontinental Film Center
results.brief_description: First in a series of nine animated films on the history of Western civilisation. This episode shows Europe emerging from the Dark Ages into a feudal maze of dukedoms and bishoprics. Covers the emergence of a new class - the merchants, and the development of new trade routes. Suitable for lower secondary levels.

results.title: A Fire called Jeremiah
results.creator_credit: James Algar and Walt Disney Productions
results.brief_description: Shows modern technical methods of fire-fighting used by the United States Forest Service to prevent forest fires from approaching gigantic proportions and destroying hundreds of human lives.

results.title: A Film for projection
results.brief_description: A short film with narration showing all the do’s and dont’s of film projection and film handling. Written by John Thompson, edited by Norman l. Ziegler, photographed by George D. Hobbs and narrated by Charles Cousens.

results.title: A Film about film making
results.creator_credit: International Film Bureau Inc and Henry Cheharbakshi
results.brief_description: An explanation about how a group of people make a film. From the idea, we see the process of choosing cast and crew, writing of the synopsis giving setting, characters of the story, clothes, props and action. The formation of a shooting script is seen, and planning of action. Finally the film is shot, edited and shown.

results.title: A Fighting chance
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Sentinel”.
Max Inglis, a Norfolk Island resident, owes his life to a recent RAAF aeromedical evacuation operation, but he is only one of thousands of Australians whose lives have been saved by this unique service.

results.title: A Field in Asia
results.creator_credit: George Wickremesinghe, Ceylon Government Film Unit, United Nations and Jehangir Bhownagary
results.brief_description: Agricultural extension officers of F.A.O. encourage Asian farmers to use better methods to increase harvests. An example in Ceylon shows use of better seed and improved sowing, cultivating and fertilising. Original music by Ravi Shankar.

results.title: A Few things I know about her
results.brief_description: Six short films which look at issues of femininity, body image, gender roles and which celebrate aspects of being a woman. A fascinating insight into what makes women tick.
